column4: Anyone knows how can i connect to wired connection using command line when I am in recovery mode?
are you on the box right now?
I am inside Live CD on the same machine that has the problem

I had 8.04 and while upgrading to 8.10 I had some issues. When I restart, I get to the login screen of ubuntu but keyboard doesn't work, and I guess it's due to broken packages, so in reconvery mode I want to fix that but I need internet connection

ok. if you can connect from the livecd you are using dhcp. if your wired network (on the broken install) is configured for using dhcp (which it most probably is) you have just to issue "ifup eth0" when you log in, provided your interface is called eth0
you have to chroot to the directory where your installation is mounted first. else you'll "apt-get update" the live session
could you pastebin the content for your /etc/network/interfaces
should i paste the interfaces output under chroot of the isntalled system?
yes, I guess it's because of that. Do you think changing the interfaces of the installed system might solve it?
you may try to sync the installed "interfaces" with the live cd file
i guess it will. but i don't know enought about wireless to assist you
another idea. if you can ping the ip, you can list the servers listed in /etc/apt/sources.list in /etc/hosts in order to get resolved
yeah. it's better to mount the /dev/ system before you chroot
